meanings.definition: Capable of being shaken or moved easily.
meanings.sent1: The table was shakeable when I bumped into it.
meanings.sent2: The loose soil was shakeable with just a light touch.
meanings.sent3: The shaky bridge was definitely shakeable, making everyone nervous.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was as shakeable as a house of cards in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The fragile glass ornaments were incredibly shakeable, requiring careful handling.

meanings.definition: Able to be disturbed or upset easily.
meanings.sent1: His emotions were so shakeable that any criticism would upset him.
meanings.sent2: The young child's feelings were easily shakeable by a simple scolding.
meanings.sent3: The cat's shakeable mood changed quickly when it saw a bird outside.
meanings.sent4: Her peace of mind was as shakeable as a Jenga tower waiting to collapse.
meanings.sent5: The delicate balance of the ecosystem was incredibly shakeable, requiring careful preservation.
